query: what is the political news from NY Times?

result.query: what is the political news from NY Times?

articles.title: Defense Lawyers for Returned Deportee Ask Judge to Release Him Pretrial
articles.description: The request came as lawyers in Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia’s separate civil case were poised to ask a different judge to hold the Trump administration in contempt for sidestepping one of her orders.

articles.title: Duffy Backs Safety Audit After Deadly Crash Near National Airport
articles.description: An investigation will examine what could have prevented an Army Black Hawk helicopter from ramming into an American Airlines flight on Jan. 29, killing all on board both aircraft.

articles.title: David Hogg to Exit DNC After Backlash to His Primary Plan
articles.description: Mr. Hogg said he would not run again for vice chair after the party voted for a new election. Democrats have been furious at his plan to challenge the party’s sitting lawmakers in primary races.

articles.title: New China Trade ‘Deal’ Takes U.S. Back to Where It Started
articles.description: If a handshake agreement holds, it will merely undo some of the damage from the trade war that President Trump started.

articles.title: In Trump’s Washington, ‘You Don’t Leave Home Without Your Lawyer’
articles.description: There’s a lot of work for lawyers in the nation’s capital these days: Over 400 lawsuits have been filed against President Trump’s administration since the start of his second term.

articles.title: Trump Bends Military’s Role, Suggesting More Troops in More Cities
articles.description: President Trump has expanded domestic use of the armed forces, testing the limits on involving troops at protests and the border.

articles.title: No, Not That Lee. Pentagon Finds Black Hero to Rechristen Base Long Named for Robert E.
articles.description: The Army unveiled a list of seven installations that the Trump administration is reverting, sort of, to earlier names venerating Confederate heroes.

articles.title: Kosovo will accept up to 50 deported migrants from America.
McConnell Tells Hegseth U.S. Reputation Is at Stake in Ukraine War
articles.description: A testy exchange between a senator who strongly supports Ukraine aid and the defense secretary revealed a deepening split among G.O.P. officials on the war.

articles.title: U.S. to Evacuate Diplomats From Iraq Amid Iran Tensions
articles.description: The State Department said it had decided to shrink the U.S. “footprint” in Baghdad, and Britain issued a warning about “increased tensions within the region.”

articles.title: Reeves boosts NHS and housing as some budgets squeezed
articles.description: Some departments, including the Home Office and Foreign Office, have lost out in the government's Spending Review.

articles.description: Talks on rules governing the border of Spain and Gibraltar have been ongoing since Britain left the EU.

articles.title: UK will end use of asylum hotels by 2029, Reeves says
articles.description: The Chancellor pledged £200m to "cut the asylum backlog" and speed up deportations.

articles.title: Tories accuse PM of funding tax cuts for Mauritians

articles.title: Rough sleeping to be decriminalised in England and Wales
articles.description: The government plans to scrap the Vagrancy Act and bring in laws to focus on crimes like organised begging by gangs.

articles.title: Scrap Chagos Islands deal and agree new one, UN panel urges UK
articles.description: A UN human rights panel says the deal "fails to guarantee" the rights of Chagossians.

articles.title: UK sanctions far-right Israeli ministers for 'inciting violence' against Palestinians
